title: Verify web scraper collects data from Instagram and public sites
description: Test that the web scraping collector successfully acquires up-to-date arts and culture event and grant data from Instagram and configured public sites, and handles pagination and rate limits properly.

steps.description: Trigger the web scraping collector module manually or via scheduled job.
Verify data is fetched successfully from Instagram endpoints and public sites.
Check that scraped data contains required fields such as event name, deadline, category, and source URL.
Ensure pagination is handled correctly and all pages are crawled.
Verify the system handles HTTP errors (e.g. 429 rate limit, 500 server errors) gracefully and retries or skips as appropriate.

title: Validate AI-powered metadata extraction accuracy
description: Confirm that the Google Gemini AI metadata extraction properly analyzes scraped event and grant data to enrich and accurately extract key metadata fields.

steps.description: Feed a batch of raw scraped event text and images to the AI metadata extractor.
Verify that extracted metadata includes event title, location, deadlines, support details, and categories.
Check the completeness and correctness of the output fields compared to the raw input.
Test with edge cases such as incomplete event descriptions or ambiguous information to see AI handling.

title: Test image processing pipeline and thumbnail optimization
description: Ensure that event images are processed and thumbnails are generated efficiently with optimized quality and size for faster frontend loading.

steps.description: Upload a variety of original event images of different formats and sizes.
Verify that thumbnails are generated conforming to expected dimensions and file size limits.
Check that image quality is visually acceptable without unnecessary artifacts.
Confirm that image processing fails gracefully and logs errors for corrupted or unsupported formats.

title: Verify frontend search and filtering functionality
description: Test the user interface's ability to accept search queries and apply filters such as genre, region, and source, updating results in real-time accurately.

steps.description: Navigate to main dashboard and enter a search query in the search bar.
Apply combination filters including genre, region, and source.
Confirm that results update in real-time matching the search and filter criteria.
Verify the metadata displayed on each result card is correct including deadline badges, categories, and links.
Test sorting options by deadline urgency, newest entries, and alphabetical order.
Check that sorting correctly reorders the results based on selection.
Input a search query with no matching results.
Verify that an informative empty state UI is displayed guiding the user.

title: Test responsive design and accessibility on frontend
description: Ensure that the frontend UI is responsive across multiple devices (mobile, tablet, desktop) and supports accessibility features including keyboard navigation and semantic HTML usage.

steps.description: Access the frontend UI from devices with different screen sizes and orientations.
Verify layout adapts seamlessly without element overlap or content clipping.
Navigate the interface using keyboard only (tab, arrow keys, enter).
Confirm that focus states are visible and all interactive elements accessible.
Use accessibility evaluation tools to check for correct usage of semantic HTML tags and ARIA attributes.
Ensure no critical accessibility violations are found.

title: Verify admin dashboard data curation and direct message management
description: Test admin dashboard functionalities for managing event/grant data curation and overseeing direct messages to ensure data quality and user communication.

steps.description: Login to admin dashboard with valid admin credentials.
Verify admin can view a list of scraped events and grants pending curation.
Perform updates or corrections on event metadata.
Confirm updated data is saved and reflected in frontend user views.
Access direct message management interface.
Send, receive, and delete messages.
Ensure messages are correctly handled and updated in real-time.

title: Validate Telegram notification system functionality
description: Check that the integrated Telegram alert system sends timely notifications to subscribed users about new or updated grants/events according to defined rules.

steps.description: Subscribe a test Telegram account to notifications with specific filters.
Trigger new event/grant addition or update in the backend.
Verify that the Telegram account receives the appropriate alert with correct details and links.
Check that notification delays are within acceptable timeframes.
Test unsubscription and verify no further notifications are received.

title: API error handling and response time validation
description: Ensure all backend API endpoints respond within defined time limits and return correct data formats and error messages under normal and error conditions.

steps.description: Send valid API requests to all public and admin endpoints.
Verify response time is within SLA limits.
Check response data formats conform to API specification (JSON schemas).
Send API requests with invalid or missing parameters.
Confirm appropriate error response codes and messages are returned.
Simulate backend service failures.
Verify system returns graceful fallback error messages without crashing.

title: TypeScript strict mode and typing coverage verification
description: Ensure that all frontend components and modules are implemented with strict TypeScript mode enabled and have complete typing coverage for maintainability and clarity.

steps.description: Perform static code analysis and compilation with TypeScript strict mode enabled.
Verify no compilation errors or implicit any types.
Ensure all components, props, and functions have explicit and correct types.

title: Empty state UI and error state display on frontend
description: Validate frontend displays appropriate UI feedback when no search results match, or when data loading or error states occur.

steps.description: Perform a search/filter with criteria that matches no events or grants.
Verify the empty state message and UI elements are displayed clearly with guidance.
Simulate API data loading and network delays.
Check that loading indicators are visible during data fetch.
Simulate API error response.
Confirm that user-friendly error messages are shown.
